extendedIngredients.name: brussels sprouts
extendedIngredients.original: 1 pound fresh Brussels sprouts, rinsed and trimmed
extendedIngredients.originalName: fresh Brussels sprouts, rinsed and trimmed

title: Brussels Sprouts with Pecans and Cranberries
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Brussels Sprouts with Pecans and Cranberries a try. Watching your figure? This gluten free, primal, and vegetarian recipe has 179 calories, 3g of protein, and 12g of fat per serving. For 96 cents per serving, this recipe covers 13% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 8. It is brought to you by Foodnetwork. 1 person found this recipe to be tasty and satisfying. Christmas will be even more special with this recipe. If you have brussels sprouts, cranberries, butter, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 25 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 45%. This score is solid. Try Brussels Sprouts with Pecans and Cranberries, Brussels Sprouts with Bacon, Cranberries and Pecans, and Alton Brown's Brussels Sprouts With Pecans and Cranberries for similar recipes.
instructions: Watch how to make this recipe.                    Slice the Brussels sprouts using the thinnest slicing disk of a food processor. If you do not have a food processor, you may slice thinly with a knife or a mandoline.                          Set a 10-inch straight-sided saute pan over medium-high heat and add the pecans. Cook, stirring continually, until the pecans darken in color and begin to give off a toasted aroma, approximately 2 minutes. Add the butter to the pan and stir to combine. Once the butter has melted, add the Brussels sprouts, salt and pepper and cook, stirring continually, until the color brightens and the sprouts are just tender, approximately 6 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat, add the cranberries, toss and serve.

steps.step: Watch how to make this recipe.
Slice the Brussels sprouts using the thinnest slicing disk of a food processor. If you do not have a food processor, you may slice thinly with a knife or a mandoline.

Set a 10-inch straight-sided saute pan over medium-high heat and add the pecans. Cook, stirring continually, until the pecans darken in color and begin to give off a toasted aroma, approximately 2 minutes.

Add the butter to the pan and stir to combine. Once the butter has melted, add the Brussels sprouts, salt and pepper and cook, stirring continually, until the color brightens and the sprouts are just tender, approximately 6 minutes.
Remove the pan from the heat, add the cranberries, toss and serve.
